reviewText: This workout is somewhat challenging and fun. Amy isn't annoying to listen to, either.It is broken up into three main segments, a 25 minute cardio section, 20 minutes of strength and a 10 minute ab section. There is also a bonus yoga stretch at the end.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I find that I work up a good sweat with this - plus I feel great and energized after the workout.  Nothing feels pulled the next day.  (I have many Jillian DVDs - and often find my AT band hurts the next day.)  The way the workout is arranged is interesting enough that I end up doing the whole thing.  I particularly like the strength section.  The moves are unique and challenging.  A 5 pound weight is held in each hand throughout.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is my 2nd Women's Health workout DVD & while I like the other one, I love this one!  90% of the time I do not enjoy DVD cardio workouts - most of the time they are too dancy or have to many jumps in them, but the cardio section in this dvd is great!  The moves are completely different than anything I have ever done before.  While I was sore the next day, it was a great workout.  The strength section was also enjoyable, but some of the moves I had to watch her go through them once before joining in. Even though I felt great after & could feel it the next day.  The bonus yoga athletic segment is a great stretch - the towel makes a much bigger difference than I thought it would.  I would highly recommend this dvd!
Title: N/A

reviewText: But I did enjoy the strength and the core sections.  I'm pretty uncoordinated myself and I didn't have much trouble following the cardio moves, but that being said, I just didn't feel like I got that great of a workout.  Once that part was over I mainly felt like I could have worked much harder.  Frankly I felt like my heart rate was up much more in the strength section.  I don't know if it's just me but when I do squats and lunges I get sweaty and my heart rate goes up.  Anyway, I found the warm up pretty dull and almost turned it off.  The cardio was OK if you're trying to take it easy.  But the strength and core sections were very good.  My shoulders are by far the weakest part of my upper body and I had to stick with 5lb weights the whole workout instead of switching to 8lbs like I thought I would.  The core section was also good - although I do wish she would have done more reps for some of the exercises.  Overall it's a decent workout, but I would definitely pick something else for the cardio portion.
summary: The cardio segment wasn't that great...
Title: N/A

reviewText: CALORIC BURN: First I'll touch on the caloric burn of the dvd because that's, after all, the biggest need I have in a fitness dvd. I workout daily to a large library of exercise dvds that I've collected over the years in order to keep it interesting and new with varied trainers, sets, music, and routines that challenge different muscles. I measure the caloric burn of a dvd by wearing a bodybugg which tells me not only how many calories I burn per day, but also during a workout including how many calories are burned per minute during that workout. I mention this only so you know what I say is based upon scientific measurement rather than perceived exertion. The calorie burn was very high on this dvd with one of the higher measures of caloric burn per minute from my collection.But better yet, I didn't feel "wiped out" by doing it. It was energizing and many of the moves were unique.ROUTINES INCLUDED: The dvd contains 3 different workouts, a high energy cardio with some fun sports-based moves (dont let that scare you off...I was picked last for p.e. teams during my entire childhood and couldn't do a sport aside from skiing, watersports, and iceskating to save my life)...but it made it fun to move three steps than lunge foreward with a raquetless hand as though swiping a ball. In all honesty this was similar to a kickboxing move with the same upper and lower body cardio results...but was fun and new to learn within the routine. Also during the warm up to do a tai chi move called "moving water"...just new things I'd never done before in spite of this being my primary method of fitness...moves with the backstroke as in swimming are another example...I like that.  Fu with good results. Also it has a strength training and balance session and then the next segment is strictly for core and abs.CUEING: She's a pro at cueing. She reaaaaally ensures you know just what's coming up and that you get the steps down with your feet before hand movements are added in during the aerobics.MUSIC;The music is some of the best I've heard as far as being in sync with the routine. It moves to the beat of the movement but then when the instructor starts going faster and into a more rigorous part of the routine the music is more dramatic too...I felt this was energizing and I noticed it.MUSCLES WORKED: the moves picked in just the cardio portion (aside from the strength session) were well thought out including many standing ab moves via twists etc so that you work out upper, lower, body and good core while burning mega calories in cardio...well thought out for utmost caloric burn.SET: the set is, or is made to look like, it's back stage of a theater.INSTRUCTOR TEAM: there is a back up team of all shapes and sizes which is nice.TRAINING STYLE: Amy Dixon has a good combo for a trainer...she's tough but warm rather than tough but annoying. She pushes you hard yet you LIKE her and she truly seems to enjoy what she's doing.CONCLUSION: this is one I frequently recommend.NEGATIVES: Some might not like the background shouts of "yeah!" "wow!" etc. I usually hate these in some videos I have because they seem so dang fake and rehearsed but just for me I didn't feel that way in this one...not sure why...maybe because they seemed genuine and weren't so frequent as to bug me and were done after you were pushed hard and kinda felt the same thing. Still, if you want low key know that they are there because you might not like that.ALTERNATIVES: Similar to Amy Dixon's other workouts if you like those or, if you haven't tried them and like this one you should like them, you might also like Jillian Michaels Lose Fat Boost Metabolism dvd as well if you like this one. It's another strong calorie burner (actually it burned a bit more) and really covers all muscles too but she isn't as condescending in this new dvd as she was in some others she did where she also had odd nervous laughter. She finally seems comfortable and offers great energy and motivation in that one. Weight Loss Cardio Sculpt with Violet Zaki was another recent one I found that has similar attributes, good burn and good instruction too.
summary: Great cueing and measured high for calorie burn
Title: N/A

reviewText: I bought this workout when I became bored after years of using Dixon's "Fat Burn" workout. This is a bit more strenuous with more complicated movements, though not too complicated. However, I just didn't find the choreography as interesting as this one.I love the fact that this has three main sections: cardio+cool down followed by strength+cool down and then core. There is also a bonus yoga segment.Since the entire program is more than an hour long, I can choose to do just two or three of the segments at a time and really get a good workout.
summary: Great total body workout, but less varied choreography than other Dixon DVDs

reviewText: This is part of the reason why I do workout DVDs and not a class at the gym.I find these class type workouts with screeching, hollering participants distracting and annoying.I am not keen on the instructor's voice or moves, either.So, depending on what kind of workout instructor and environment you prefer, you will love this --- or hate this, as I do.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Although this DVD dates back to 2007 with a very young looking Amy Dixon, it is a fun and very complete workout.  The ONLY reason I docked it one star is because I would have preferred to see both the cardio and strength training section to have been at least 30 minutes long each, rather than the roughly 20 minutes as presented here.  Amy is one of the most motivating instructors out there, with spot on cueing and lots of enthusiasm as well as a lot of creative, new moves.  IN the first half of the cardio section she takes moves from three sports and translates them to a cardio workout.  She does an amazing job of mimicking swimming movements to a standing posture; well done!  The second part of the cardio is kickboxing.  As far as the strength training, Amy's specialty is slowly building multiple muscle moves.  And she adds a 10-minute abs segment, finally followed by a 10-minute stretch.  Amy is an outstanding trainer and I highly recommend this video.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I'm glad I bought this as a used DVD (on Amazon, of course). I found the lack of 'reps' annoying at times. Five of some, more of others, but I don't think there were ever 15 of anything. And further annoyed with the idea of "watch Beth" if you needed modifications. That was a joke!! Maybe they should have hired me for that individual. She basically did the same, except for a few leg lifts. And often times was not even shown. IF you're going to suggest a 'modified' person to follow, then it should be for real and noticeable.Oh, almost forgot. Those "whoa", "woo" and such were very annoying. Maybe a 'beat' music, lightly, in the background would have improved the atmosphere. They really were annoying to me, on replays. Dixon herself, gives good commands and pre-announce of next phase, just wanted MORE reps of each phase, no matter that they may have led into a similar sequence.Perhaps, even an extra track just giving some personalized modifications in an added 10 min segment. That should not be asking too much.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I like the workout. It is fast but does not kill you. Amy eases you into the moves and is good with her Q's. I would recomend this for someone who wants a fast pace workout that is fun and moves smoothly.

Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD had great reviews so I had really high expectations for it and was slightly disappointed.  Amy Dixon is amazing!  She's super sweet and not at all overly peppy or annoying as some instructors can be, and I'm still trying to figure out if the DVD felt like it was pretty easy because she was so motivating or if the DVD was actually just that easy.I had problems with the planks because of my wrist issues and had to modify as much as I could and while I don't blame her or the DVD for that, I did feel the cardio section was lacking and over a little too quickly.  I expected much more from this DVD in that aspect.  I enjoyed the tone/strengthening section, although it was pretty easy.I did sweat and my heart rate did get up, but I did expect to be much more tired after I completed it and was expecting a "I can't walk the next day" soreness.  It was still pretty enjoyable, just not what I expected or was looking for.  Not to say I won't do it again and I would definitely get one of her DVDs again, but this one's cardio was just too easy for what I wanted.
summary: Decent DVD but I expected more....

reviewText: Women's Health Perfect Body Workout with Amy Dixon is a solid fitness DVD designed especially to help women burn calories with high energy cardio moves based on various sports, strength training to the tone the body, core moves to improve the abs, and a bonus yoga athletic stretch segment. The only required equipment is a few inexpensive items: 5-pound hand weights, floor mat, towel, and remote control. Led by L.A.-based celebrity trainer and "Women's Health" magazine contributing editor Amy Dixon, Women's Health Perfect Body Workout lives up to its title and is an excellent addition to any woman's DVD workout regimen. 69 minutes, color.
summary: An excellent addition to any woman's DVD workout regimen.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is another great video from Amy Dixon. Amy is one of the best instructors out there. Her videos are fun to do and typically pretty easy to follow. Amy is motivational and NOT irritating - a very important quality in a fitness instructor!This video is split into segements: a cardio segment and a weight segment, with optional bonuses of core work and a yoga inspired stretch.1. The weight segment: Excellent! You'll use a set of five pound weights, though I sometimes upgrade to 8 pounds for a specific move that I feel like I need more weight for, and you could probably switch to 3 pounds for more difficult moves. All of the moves incorporate more than once muscle group, so you'll keep your heart rate up after the cardio section. A lot of the moves incorporate balance as well. I love this weight segment. There were a lot of moves that I had never seen before. She keeps it varied and interesting, and tough. You'll definitely feel like you're working, but it's fun. This is one of my favorite weight routines I've ever done.2. The core segment: This is definitely a challenge, though sometimes I find it a little bit easier and other days it totally kicks my butt. Don't know why. Like the weight section, there are both classic moves and a bunch I've never done before. And she doesn't forget to include some back strengtheners, which I love. Great core segment that you'll keep going back to.3. The yoga stretch: I love this stretch segment. It's awesome! You'll need a towel to do it, so have one ready.4. The cardio segment: This is actually the first segment, but I saved it for last because it's the only section I don't like, and the reason I gave the video four stars instead of five. The exercises in the cardio section are based on different athletic activites, such as skating, swimming, etc. Some of these moves are fine, but I found most of them confusing and difficult to follow. Also, they require you to have a lot of space. I have a pretty decent sized basement that I work out in, and have a large library of workout dvds that I like to use. This is the only video where I've had to turn and try to do it diagonally, and even then I don't really have as much as room as I'd like to do these moves. For the most part this section leaves me feeling awkward, and even after doing it 2 or 3 times, I have to stop to watch a lot which means I don't get as much out of it as I'd like. Most of the time I just skip this section and combine the rest of the video with something else. It will get your heart rate up, though, and it's probably the kind of thing that a lot of people will really enjoy but just wasn't for me.Bottom line: One of my favorite work out videos, but for me a subpar cardio segment.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I started using this workout about three weeks ago and I have seen inch loss and a flat stomache that I was unable to achieve with other workouts.  I have never been overweight so that is not a problem but keeping an over 40 body free of trouble spots and keeping flexible is my goal.  This workout is fast paced and dancey with great music and instruction.  I tried on my jeans today and they are loose around the midsection and my butt is lifted and looks great and young.  This is the best workout I have tried and I have tried many.  I just dont know where some people are coming from when they criticize this workout as I feel it is very well done in all aspects.  I think some people because they cant do the workout because they are so out of shape like to put the blame on amy and plus some people would criticize jesus christ if he were back on earth.  Highly recommended.
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you get bored doing just bicep curls, tricep dips, and billions of crunches then this DVD is for you. The cardio is great-- long enough to boost your heart rate so you can maximize the following 2 portions (strength and abs). The strength training is tough-- and you're not isolating muscle groups to work on them. Amy has you do things like stand on your toes or stay in a squat or hop so you work multiple groups of muscles at the same time. After the workout you feel like you really worked your butt off. I like that she converses with you and the women around her to make you feel empowered and not some schmuck who let herself go! Outtakes are funny, too. :) I feel like I have a gym partner in her.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I consider myself an advanced beginner and really enjoyed my workout. I've been doing the Jillian Michaels Shred everyday for a month and a half now and wanted a longer workout, but one that was still a full body one with some good core excercises. This was exactly what I was looking for.While I did opt for the modified versions when appropriate I never had to stop and I feel like this is the kind of workout that I, as an advanced beginner can really work into. Also, being a plus sized woman, it's great to get a good cardio without too much jumping around.I highly reccomend this for either an advanced beginner or intermediate person.The one thing that I was pleasantly surprised about was how much I liked her personality. One thing I definitly do not like about using DVDs is how perky and 'encouraging' the instructor can be. It just ticks me off. (Okay it makes me yell at the screen.) I usually turn off the commentary as soon as I get the routine down so I don't have to listen to them. I don't think I will have to do that with this, which means I will gain the benefit of being reminded of good form and reap the benefits of her excellent cuing.The moves in the cardio themselves can be sort of complex, but they aren't so much so that after a few times with the video anyone can't get them.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I couldn't wait to get this DVD after using Amy Dixon's other two (Total Workout and Ultimate Fat Burn). She is very motivating and gives great ques for what's coming up. Awesome cardio and strength work. This kicks my booty so I wouldn't recommend it to a beginner. Thank you Amy Dixon for another great DVD!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This was my first purchase ever of a Women's Health workout DVD, and I wasn't disappointed.  Amy Dixon is a good instructor, and she's not annoyingly perky but motivating instead (although she does move a bit fast).  She truly tested the extent of my coordination with her combination moves (my husband got a good chuckle watching me try to combine all the sports moves in the cardio workout).  However, she does give a solid workout overall.  The DVD contains a cardio segment, a strength segment, and a core segment, with a bonus yoga stretch that is nice.  The cardio segment didn't get my heart rate up as much as I would have liked, but that was probably because I was too busy looking like a spaz trying to combine some of the moves.  The strength and core segments are very good; however, on the strength segment, they suggest using 5 pound weights.  I tried, I really did--but I had to switch to 3 pounds for movements that made you do straight arms.  Given the fast pace, there wasn't much time to make that switch!  But she does cue quite nicely, and does let you know when something new is coming up (even if you're not sure what it is when she just tells you the name of it) so you're prepared.The fast pace was not all bad--I loved how she made you repeat a move just enough to give you a burn, and then combined that with another move.  The overall workout did go by very fast because of that, and it kept me motivated throughout. I definitely felt the afterburn with this one.The one huge thing I did notice was ALL THE SQUATS!  Having an issue with my right knee, I had to go easy on those after a while.  But Amy does instruct you on proper form, and several times reminds you to keep your weight in your heels during squats.  Those were nice reminders for me during the workout.  And they nicely point out the person behind her who is doing the modified moves, which I took advantage of at times.Like I said, you will definitely feel the afterburn on this one, and it is a workout I will definitely keep in my rotation.  I wasn't wowed by it, but felt that overall it is a solid workout worth investing in.  I also loved the fact that it has the different sections, so you can choose to do the whole video, or just do some cardio, strength, or core work separately if you are short on time.  A good buy that I would recommend to others.Edited to add:  I woke up the day after doing this, and my entire body is SORE (the good kind).  If you want to shake up your normal routine and try some very different moves, this DVD will do it for you.

reviewText: I love all of Amy Dixon's videos. This one is no exception! I just got it and ran through it once. It's pretty tough and much more comprehensive than her others. It's definitely for a day when you have at least an hour but she puts your body through a great workout! I like how it has all three components, cardio, weights and then abs. Amy is a great instructor and I am grateful for her and Women's Health! They have made me an exercise DVD fan!!!!!!

reviewText: As aerobic intructors go, I've never seen someone better at cueing and motivating.  Amy can seem a bit intense with all her affirmative shouts of "yes!", "hah!", "amazing!", and "go get it!" to name a few; but despite this, I really enjoy the workout and find her to be more encouraging than annoying.This DVD is jam-packed with workout material (a GREAT value for the price!), and you can choose whichever segments to customize your workout how you want it for that day.  In each segment there are plenty of different movements, so it never gets old or repetitive.  And you really do work every muscle!  Definitely an essential in my workout DVD collection.

reviewText: I really like this instructor, she seems real and not too many cheesy catchphrases. The DVD is broken up into cardo and strenth - I like intervals better because it usually keeps my heartrate up. During cardio and standing toning - my heartrate is around 50-60% of maximum which is pretty good for me. Cardio isn't too complicated, so I can get repetitive. Toning is mostly upper/lower together, which is great for keeping up your heartrate.

reviewText: I really love these new Women's Health workout series.  I have the previous series and lost interest quickly with those.  Not these workouts.  Amy Dixon is very energetic and encouraging.  I found this workout to be very fast paced and well structured.  It took a couple times going through to get all the moves but you definitely feel the workout later in the day and by the next day.  I found the moves to really work the trouble areas we all have and like the burn afterwards, not to mention sweat.  This is a great total body workout and one you can do in segments depending on what area you want to work.  I loved all the sections and the bonus segment as well.  Hope to see more Amy Dixon workouts by Women's health.  A real keeper.
summary: Amy Dixon is One of My favorite Instructors Now
